posts.name: acastagna
posts.cooked:
We have an arduCam (B0390) camera module for our raspberry pi.  It uses the Sony IMX219 sensor.  We were able to get the camera working when using the Photon Vision image by following adding a line to config.txt:  dtoverlay=imx219.

We want to get it going using the wpilibPi image, but no luck. We tried  these:

camera_auto_detect=1 dtoverlay=imx219

and

camera_auto_detect=0 dtoverlay=imx219

and  just dtoverlay=imx219

What am I missing?  Something in the config.txt file or is there some particular way to get to that camera feed in the WPIPi  web interface?

I ran the following diagnostics: pi@wpilibpi(ro):~$ v4l2-ctl --list-devices bcm2835-codec-decode (platform:bcm2835-codec): /dev/video10 /dev/video11 /dev/video12 /dev/video18 /dev/video31 /dev/media3

bcm2835-isp (platform:bcm2835-isp): /dev/video13 /dev/video14 /dev/video15 /dev/video16 /dev/video20 /dev/video21 /dev/video22 /dev/video23 /dev/media1 /dev/media2

unicam (platform:fe801000.csi): /dev/video0 /dev/video1 /dev/media4

rpivid (platform:rpivid): /dev/video19 /dev/media0

pi@wpilibpi(ro):~$ v4l2-ctl --list-formats ioctl: VIDIOC_ENUM_FMT Type: Video Capture

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Change config.txt to be:

And you have to set the capture format to YUYV.  Check dmesg for any errors if you run into problems (e.g. some cameras only like to be run at certain resolutions).

I just figured this out this weekend and am working on documenting it.

The root cause of this problem is the V4L2 compatibility layer of the libcamera layer in Linux has some issues.  I’ll be looking at utilizing libcamera directly in future years, but for now this workaround seems to work.

posts.name: acastagna
posts.cooked: I didn’t have any luck with that.  Here’s the error messages. Same thing running through radio and running connected directly to laptop.

posts.name: acastagna
posts.cooked: Wait - I didnt do the capture format.  I’ll fix that tonight

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: I suspect cscore won’t work with mipi csi cameras this year. You may have to use libcamera directly. What language are you using? Python? Try using the pycamera2 or whatever library

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: I’ve tested with at least the 32-bit image and it works, but you have to be a lot more careful to use the config.txt lines and the right format/resolution than in previous years.

posts.name: acastagna
posts.cooked: Where do you change the capture format?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Click on the camera name on the Vision Settings tab, you can change the pixel format and resolution there.

You can use the dmesg command in ssh to see if there’s more specific errors being put out by the driver.

posts.name: acastagna
posts.cooked:
I was eventually able to get the Arducam picamera2 to work with with wpilib image, and get it to detect april tags. Thank you to everyone who provided input!

I ended up using  “dtoverlay=imx219” in the config file, but without the media-controller specification.

I modified the python code from veg https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/using-apriltag-on-raspberry-pi/423250/16 to look like this:

Now we can detect April tags and see the stream using the wpilib web interface. Camera exposure can be controlled by the python code as shown.

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: Note from another implementor: you’ll wanna calibrate your camera and undistort the corner points before giving them to estimate tag pose orthogonal iteration
